description.current: Print a synopsis of standard options.
Print a synopsis of advanced options.
Display the compiler version.
Enable verbose logging output.
Don't generate any warnings.
Report an error if there are any warnings.
Enable extra checkers for K2.
Provide source compatibility with the specified version of Kotlin.
Allow using declarations from only the specified version of bundled libraries.
Path to the Kotlin compiler home directory used for the discovery of runtime libraries.

Enable progressive compiler mode.
In this mode, deprecations and bug fixes for unstable code take effect immediately
instead of going through a graceful migration cycle.
Code written in progressive mode is backward compatible; however, code written without
progressive mode enabled may cause compilation errors in progressive mode.
Evaluate the given Kotlin script (*.kts) file.
Run Kotlin REPL (deprecated)
Enable API usages that require opt-in with an opt-in requirement marker with the given fully qualified name.
Disable method inlining.
Allow loading classes with bad metadata versions and pre-release classes.
Allow loading pre-release classes.
Allow compiling code in the 'kotlin' package, and allow not requiring 'kotlin.stdlib' in 'module-info'.
Enables special features which are relevant only for stdlib compilation.
Report the source-to-output file mapping.
Load plugins from the given classpath.
Pass an option to a plugin.
Register a compiler plugin.

Specify an execution order constraint for compiler plugins.
Order constraint can be specified using the 'pluginId' of compiler plugins.
The first specified plugin will be executed before the second plugin.
Multiple constraints can be specified by repeating this option. Cycles in constraints will cause an error.
Enable language support for multiplatform projects.
Do not check for the presence of the 'actual' modifier in multiplatform projects.
Path to 'kotlin-compiler.jar' or the directory where the IntelliJ IDEA configuration files can be found.
Enable the new experimental generic type inference algorithm.
Enable experimental inline classes.
Report detailed performance statistics.

Enable more detailed performance statistics (Experimental).
For Native, the performance report includes execution time and lines processed per second for every individual lowering.
For WASM and JS, the performance report includes execution time and lines per second for each lowering of the first stage of compilation.

Dump detailed performance statistics to the specified file in plain text, JSON or markdown format (it's detected by the file's extension).
Also, it supports the placeholder `*` and directory for generating file names based on the module being compiled and the current time stamp.
Example: `path/to/dir/*.log` creates logs like `path/to/dir/my-module_2025-06-20-12-22-32.log` in plain text format, `path/to/dir/` creates logs like `path/to/dir/my-log_2025-06-20-12-22-32.json`.
Change the metadata version of the generated binary files.

Sources of the common module that need to be compiled together with this module in multiplatform mode.
They should be a subset of sources passed as free arguments.
List backend phases.
Disable backend phases.
Be verbose while performing the given backend phases.
Dump the backend's state before these phases.
Dump the backend's state after these phases.
Dump the backend's state both before and after these phases.
Dump the backend state into this directory.
Dump the declaration with the given FqName.
Validate the backend's state before these phases.
Validate the backend's state after these phases.
Validate the backend's state both before and after these phases.
IR verification mode (no verification by default).
Check for visibility violations in IR when validating it before running any lowerings. Only has effect if '-Xverify-ir' is not 'none'.
Profile backend phases.
Check pre- and postconditions of IR lowering phases.
Compile using the experimental K2 compiler pipeline. No compatibility guarantees are provided yet.
Enable experimental frontend IR checkers that are not yet ready for production.

Compile using frontend IR internal incremental compilation.
Warning: This feature is not yet production-ready.
Compile using the LightTree parser with the frontend IR.
Produce a klib that only contains the metadata of declarations.
Don't enable the scripting plugin by default.

Force the compiler to report errors on all public API declarations without an explicit visibility or a return type.
Use the 'warning' level to issue warnings instead of errors.

Force the compiler to report errors on all public API declarations without an explicit return type.
Use the 'warning' level to issue warnings instead of errors.
This flag partially enables functionality of `-Xexplicit-api` flag, so please don't use them altogether
Set improved unused return value checker mode. Use 'check' to run checker only and use 'full' to also enable automatic annotation insertion.
Suppress warnings about outdated, inconsistent, or experimental language or API versions.

Suppress error about API version greater than language version.
Warning: This is temporary solution (see KT-63712) intended to be used only for stdlib build.

'expect'/'actual' classes (including interfaces, objects, annotations, enums, and 'actual' typealiases) are in Beta.
Kotlin reports a warning every time you use one of them. You can use this flag to mute the warning.
The effect of this compiler flag is the same as applying @ConsistentCopyVisibility annotation to all data classes in the module. See https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/KT-11914
Eliminate builder inference restrictions, for example by allowing type variables to be returned from builder inference calls.
Enable experimental context receivers.
Enable experimental context parameters.
Enable experimental context-sensitive resolution.
Enable experimental non-local break and continue.
Enable `when` exhaustiveness improvements that rely on data-flow analysis.
Enable experimental language support for explicit backing fields.
Enable experimental direct Java actualization support.
Enable experimental multi-dollar interpolation.
Enable incremental compilation.
Render the internal names of warnings and errors.
Allow compiling scripts along with regular Kotlin sources.
Report all warnings even if errors are found.
Declare all known fragments of a multiplatform compilation.
Add sources to a specific fragment of a multiplatform compilation.
Declare that <fromModuleName> refines <onModuleName> with the dependsOn/refines relation.

Declare common klib dependencies for the specific fragment.
This argument is required for any HMPP module except the platform leaf module: it takes dependencies from -cp/-libraries.
The argument should be used only if the new compilation scheme is enabled with -Xseparate-kmp-compilation
Enables the separated compilation scheme, in which common source sets are analyzed against their own dependencies
Ignore all compilation exceptions while optimizing some constant expressions.
Don't report warnings when errors are suppressed. This only affects K2.
Enable experimental language support for when guards.
Enable experimental language support for nested type aliases.
Suppress specified warning module-wide. This option is deprecated in favor of "-Xwarning-level" flag

Set the severity of the given warning.
- `error` level raises the severity of a warning to error level (similar to -Werror but more granular)
- `disabled` level suppresses reporting of a warning (similar to -nowarn but more granular)
- `warning` level overrides -nowarn and -Werror for this specific warning (the warning will be reported/won't be considered as an error)
Enable debug level compiler checks. ATTENTION: these checks can slow compiler down or even crash it.
Enable experimental language support for @all: annotation use-site target.
Lenient compiler mode. When actuals are missing, placeholder declarations are generated.
Allow 'catch' parameters to have reified types.
Allow contracts on some operators and accessors, and allow checks for erased types.
Allow contracts that specify a limited conditional returns postcondition.
Allow contracts that specify a condition that holds true inside a lambda argument.
Destination for generated class files.
List of directories and JAR/ZIP archives to search for user class files.
Include the Kotlin runtime in the resulting JAR.
Include a custom JDK from the specified location in the classpath instead of the default 'JAVA_HOME'.
Don't automatically include the Java runtime in the classpath.
Don't automatically include the Kotlin/JVM stdlib and Kotlin reflection dependencies in the classpath.
Don't automatically include the Kotlin reflection dependency in the classpath.
Evaluate the given string as a Kotlin script.
Script definition template classes.
Name of the generated '.kotlin_module' file.
The target version of the generated JVM bytecode (1.8 and 9–24), with 1.8 as the default.
Generate metadata for Java 1.8 reflection on method parameters.

Emit JVM default methods for interface declarations with bodies. The default is 'enable'.
-jvm-default=enable              Generate default methods for non-abstract interface declarations, as well as 'DefaultImpls' classes with
                                 static methods for compatibility with code compiled in the 'disable' mode.
                                 This is the default behavior since language version 2.2.
-jvm-default=no-compatibility    Generate default methods for non-abstract interface declarations. Do not generate 'DefaultImpls' classes.
-jvm-default=disable             Do not generate JVM default methods. This is the default behavior up to language version 2.1.
Do not report errors on classes in dependencies that were compiled by an unstable version of the Kotlin compiler.

When using unstable compiler features such as FIR, use 'stable' to mark generated class files as stable
to prevent diagnostics from being reported when using stable compilers at the call site.
When using the JVM IR backend, conversely, use 'unstable' to mark generated class files as unstable
to force diagnostics to be reported.
When using the IR backend, do not clear BindingContext between 'psi2ir' and lowerings.

Run codegen phase in N parallel threads.
0 means use one thread per processor core.
The default value is 1.
Paths to Java 9+ modules.
Root modules to resolve in addition to the initial modules, or all modules on the module path if <module> is ALL-MODULE-PATH.
Don't generate not-null assertions for arguments of platform types.
Don't generate not-null assertions for extension receiver arguments of platform types.
Don't generate not-null assertions on parameters of methods accessible from Java.
Disable optimizations.
Path to the .xml build file to compile.
Compile multifile classes as a hierarchy of parts and a facade.
Use a type table in metadata serialization.

Use the old implementation for reading class files. This may slow down the compilation and cause problems with Groovy interop.
This can be used in the event of problems with the new implementation.
Use the fast implementation of Jar FS. This may speed up compilation time, but it is experimental.
Suppress the "cannot access built-in declaration" error (useful with '-no-stdlib').
Set the script resolver environment in key-value pairs (the value can be quoted and escaped).
Use javac for Java source and class file analysis.
Reuse 'javac' analysis and compile Java source files.
Java compiler arguments.
Paths to directories with Java source files.
Package prefix for Java files.

Specify the behavior of 'JSR-305' nullability annotations:
-Xjsr305={ignore/strict/warn}                   global (all non-@UnderMigration annotations)
-Xjsr305=under-migration:{ignore/strict/warn}   all @UnderMigration annotations
-Xjsr305=@<fq.name>:{ignore/strict/warn}        annotation with the given fully qualified class name
Modes:
* ignore
* strict (experimental; treat like other supported nullability annotations)
* warn (report a warning)

Specify the behavior for specific Java nullability annotations (provided with fully qualified package name).
Modes:
* ignore
* strict
* warn (report a warning)

Specify the behavior for Checker Framework 'compatqual' annotations ('NullableDecl'/'NonNullDecl').
The default value is 'enable'.

Specify the behavior of 'jspecify' annotations.
The default value is 'strict'.

valueInVersions.value:
Specify the behavior of 'jspecify' annotations.
The default value is 'warn'.

description.current:
This option is deprecated. Migrate to -jvm-default as follows:
-Xjvm-default=disable            -> -jvm-default=disable
-Xjvm-default=all-compatibility  -> -jvm-default=enable
-Xjvm-default=all                -> -jvm-default=no-compatibility
Compile expressions and unrecognized scripts passed with the -script argument as scripts with the given filename extension.
Disable standard Kotlin scripting support.
Generate metadata with strict version semantics (see the KDoc entry on 'Metadata.extraInt').

Transform '(' and ')' in method names to some other character sequence.
This mode can BREAK BINARY COMPATIBILITY and should only be used as a workaround for
problems with parentheses in identifiers on certain platforms.
Paths to output directories for friend modules (modules whose internals should be visible).
Allow the set of source files to be empty.
Emit JVM type annotations in bytecode.
Expose inline classes and functions, accepting and returning them, to Java.

Select the code generation scheme for string concatenation:
-Xstring-concat=indy-with-constants  Concatenate strings using 'invokedynamic' and 'makeConcatWithConstants'. This requires '-jvm-target 9' or greater.
-Xstring-concat=indy                 Concatenate strings using 'invokedynamic' and 'makeConcat'. This requires '-jvm-target 9' or greater.
-Xstring-concat=inline               Concatenate strings using 'StringBuilder'
default: 'indy-with-constants' for JVM targets 9 or greater, 'inline' otherwise.

Compile against the specified JDK API version, similarly to javac's '-release'. This requires JDK 9 or newer.
The supported versions depend on the JDK used; for JDK 17+, the supported versions are 1.8 and 9–24.
This also sets the value of '-jvm-target' to be equal to the selected JDK version.

Select the code generation scheme for SAM conversions.
-Xsam-conversions=indy          Generate SAM conversions using 'invokedynamic' with 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory'.
-Xsam-conversions=class         Generate SAM conversions as explicit classes.
The default value is 'indy'.

Select the code generation scheme for lambdas.
-Xlambdas=indy                  Generate lambdas using 'invokedynamic' with 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory'.
                                A lambda object created using 'LambdaMetafactory.metafactory' will have a different 'toString()'.
-Xlambdas=class                 Generate lambdas as explicit classes.
The default value is 'indy' if language version is 2.0+, and 'class' otherwise.
Allow using 'invokedynamic' for lambda expressions with annotations
Paths to cross-platform libraries in the .klib format.
Don't reset jar entry timestamps to a fixed date.
Use pre-1.4 exception types instead of 'java.lang.NPE' in null checks. See KT-22275 for more details.
Don't generate the '@kotlin.jvm.internal.SourceDebugExtension' annotation with an SMAP copy on classes.

Debug option: Run the compiler with the async profiler and save snapshots to `outputDir`; `command` is passed to the async profiler on start.
`profilerPath` is the path to libasyncProfiler.so; async-profiler.jar should be on the compiler classpath.
If it's not on the classpath, the compiler will attempt to load async-profiler.jar from the containing directory of profilerPath.
Example: -Xprofile=<PATH_TO_ASYNC_PROFILER>/async-profiler/build/libasyncProfiler.so:event=cpu,interval=1ms,threads,start:<SNAPSHOT_DIR_PATH>
Use the scheme for inline class mangling from version 1.4 instead of the one from 1.4.30.

Allow using Java features that are in the preview phase.
This works like '--enable-preview' in Java. All class files are marked as compiled with preview features, meaning it won't be possible to use them in release environments.

Suppress warnings about deprecated JVM target versions.
This option has no effect and will be deleted in a future version.

Enable strict mode for improvements to type enhancement for loaded Java types based on nullability annotations,
including the ability to read type-use annotations from class files.
See KT-45671 for more details.
Save the IR to metadata (Experimental).
Validate generated JVM bytecode before and after optimizations.
Enhance not-null-annotated type parameter types to definitely-non-nullable types ('@NotNull T' => 'T & Any').

Link JVM IR symbols via signatures instead of descriptors.
This mode is slower, but it can be useful for troubleshooting problems with the JVM IR backend.
This option is deprecated and will be deleted in future versions.
It has no effect when -language-version is 2.0 or higher.

Enable debug mode for compilation.
Currently this includes spilling all variables in a suspending context regardless of whether they are alive.
If API Level >= 2.2 -- no-op.

Generate additional linenumber instruction for compiler-generated code
inside suspend functions and lambdas to distinguish them from user code by debugger.
Don't generate Java 1.8+ targets for Kotlin annotation classes.
Enable experimental value classes.
Inline functions using the IR inliner instead of the bytecode inliner.
Use inline scopes numbers for inline marker variables.
Enable the experimental support for K2 KAPT.
Enable behaviour needed to compile builtins as part of JVM stdlib
Output builtins metadata as .kotlin_builtins files
Write annotations on declarations into the metadata (in addition to the JVM bytecode), and read annotations from the metadata if they are present.

Select the code generation scheme for type-checking 'when' expressions:
-Xwhen-expressions=indy         Generate type-checking 'when' expressions using 'invokedynamic' with 'SwitchBootstraps.typeSwitch(..)' and 
                                following 'tableswitch' or 'lookupswitch'. This requires '-jvm-target 21' or greater.
-Xwhen-expressions=inline       Generate type-checking 'when' expressions as a chain of type checks.
The default value is 'inline'.
Provide a base path to compute the source's relative paths in klib (default is empty).
Normalize absolute paths in klibs.
Enable signature uniqueness checks.
Use partial linkage mode.
Define the compile-time log level for partial linkage.
Klib dependencies usage strategy when multiple KLIBs has same `unique_name` property value.
Enable experimental support to invoke IR Inliner before Klib serialization.

Specify the custom ABI version to be written in KLIB. This option is intended only for tests.
Warning: This option does not affect KLIB ABI. Neither allows it making a KLIB backward-compatible with older ABI versions.
The only observable effect is that a custom ABI version is written to KLIB manifest file.
Use the WebAssembly compiler backend.
Set up the Wasm target (wasm-js or wasm-wasi).
Add debug info to the compiled WebAssembly module.
Avoid optimizations that can break debugging.
Compile only provided .wasm module.
Generate a .wat file.
Enable support for 'KClass.qualifiedName'.
Turn on range checks for array access functions.
Turn on asserts.
Use traps instead of throwing exceptions.
Use an updated version of the exception proposal with try_table.
Don't use WebAssembly.JSTag for throwing and catching exceptions
Generates devtools custom formatters (https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/devtools-user/custom_formatters) for Kotlin/Wasm values
Insert source mappings from libraries even if their sources are unavailable on the end-user machine.
Preserve wasm file structure between IC runs.
Do not commit IC cache updates.
Generate DWARF debug information.

Dump reachability information collected about declarations while performing DCE to a file. The format will be chosen automatically based on the file extension. Supported output formats include JSON for .json, a JS const initialized with a plain object containing information for .js, and plain text for all other file types.

Dump the IR size of each declaration into a file. The format will be chosen automatically depending on the file extension. Supported output formats include JSON for .json, a JS const initialized with a plain object containing information for .js, and plain text for all other file types.
Destination for generated files.
Base name of generated files.
Paths to Kotlin libraries with .meta.js and .kjsm files, separated by the system path separator.
Generate a source map.
Add the specified prefix to the paths in the source map.
Base directories for calculating relative paths to source files in the source map.
Embed source files into the source map.
Mode for mapping generated names to original names.
Generate JS files for the specified ECMA version.
Comma-separated list of fully qualified names not to be eliminated by DCE (if it can be reached), and for which to keep non-minified names.
The kind of JS module generated by the compiler. ES modules are enabled by default in case of ES2015 target usage
Specify whether the 'main' function should be called upon execution.
Generate an unpacked klib into the parent directory of the output JS file.
Generate a packed klib into the directory specified by '-ir-output-dir'.
Generate a JS file using the IR backend.
Perform experimental dead code elimination.
Enable runtime diagnostics instead of removing declarations when performing DCE.
Print reachability information about declarations to 'stdout' while performing DCE.
Perform lazy initialization for properties.
Minimize the names of members.
Specify the name of the compilation module for the IR backend.
Wrap access to external 'Boolean' properties with an explicit conversion to 'Boolean'.
Enable runtime diagnostics when accessing external 'Boolean' properties.
Generate one .js file per module.
Add a custom output name to the split .js files.
Generate one .js file per source file.
Lambda expressions that capture values are translated into in-line anonymous JavaScript functions.
Path to an intermediate library that should be processed in the same manner as source files.
Path to the cache directory.
Use the compiler to build the cache.
Generate a TypeScript declaration .d.ts file alongside the JS file.
Generate polyfills for features from the ES6+ standards.
Generate strict types for implicitly exported entities inside d.ts files.
Let generated JavaScript code use ES2015 classes. Enabled by default in case of ES2015 target usage
JS expression that will be executed in runtime and be put as an Array<String> parameter of the main function
Enable ES2015 generator functions usage inside the compiled code. Enabled by default in case of ES2015 target usage
Use ES2015 arrow functions in the JavaScript code generated for Kotlin lambdas. Enabled by default in case of ES2015 target usage
Compile Long values as ES2020 bigint instead of object.

This option does nothing and is left for compatibility with the legacy backend.
It is deprecated and will be removed in a future release.
Disable internal declaration export.
Paths to friend modules.
Enable extension function members in external interfaces.
Enable the IR fake override validator.
Perform additional optimizations on the generated JS code.
Enable runtime assertions in generated code.
Enable the emission of debug information.
Produce a runner for unit tests.
Produce a worker runner for unit tests.
Produce a runner for unit tests that doesn't force an exit.
Pack the given external binary into the klib.
Link with the given library.

The library version.
Note: This option is deprecated and will be removed in one of the future releases.
List available hardware targets.
Provide a manifest addend file.
Choose the memory model to be used – 'strict' and 'experimental' are currently supported.
Specify a name for the compilation module.
Include the given native bitcode library.
Don't link the libraries from dist/klib automatically.
Don't link endorsed libraries from the dist automatically. This option has been deprecated, as the dist no longer has any endorsed libraries.
Assume the 'main' entry point will be provided by external libraries.
Don't pack the library into a klib file.
Pass arguments to the linker.
Pass the given argument to the linker.
Don't link with the stdlib.
Enable optimizations during compilation.
Output name.
Qualified entry point name.
Specify the output file kind.
Set the hardware target.
Bundle ID to be set in the Info.plist file of the produced framework. This option is deprecated. Please use '-Xbinary=bundleId=<id>'.
Path to the directory containing caches.
Paths to a library and its cache, separated by a comma.

Path to the root directory from which dependencies are to be cached automatically.
By default caches will be placed into the kotlin-native system cache directory.
Path to the directory where caches for auto-cacheable dependencies should be put.
Path to the directory where incremental build caches should be put.
Check dependencies and download the missing ones.

A library to be included in the produced framework API.
This library must be one of the ones passed with '-library'.

Path to the file containing external dependencies.
External dependencies are required for verbose output in the event of IR linker errors,
but they do not affect compilation at all.
Enable the IR fake override validator.
Add an additional header import to the framework header.

Add light debug information for optimized builds. This option is skipped in debug builds.
It's enabled by default on Darwin platforms where collected debug information is stored in a .dSYM file.
Currently this option is disabled by default on other platforms.
Add light debug information. This option has been deprecated. Please use '-Xadd-light-debug=enable' instead.
Generate trampolines to make debugger breakpoint resolution more accurate (inlines, 'when', etc.).
Path to a library to be added to the cache.
Path to the file to cache.
Force the compiler to produce per-file caches.

Run codegen by file in N parallel threads.
0 means use one thread per processor core.
The default value is 1.
Export KDoc entries in the framework header.
Print LLVM bitcode.
Ensure that all calls of possibly long external functions are done in the native thread state.
Print IR.
Print files.
Don't link unused libraries even if explicitly specified.
Write file containing the paths of dependencies used during klib compilation to the provided path
Override the standard 'runtime.bc' location.
A path to an intermediate library that should be processed in the same manner as source files.
A short name used to denote this library in the IDE and in a generated Objective-C header.
Create a framework with a static library instead of a dynamic one.
Save temporary files to the given directory.
Save the result of the Kotlin IR to LLVM IR translation to '-Xsave-llvm-ir-directory'.
Verify LLVM bitcode after each method.
Verify the compiler.
Paths to friend modules.
Paths to output directories for refined modules (modules whose 'expect' declarations this module can actualize).
Generate debug info of the given version (1, 2).
Disable generics support for framework header.
Explicit list of Clang options.
Allocator used at runtime.
Save a klib that only contains the public ABI to the given path.
Remap file source directory paths in debug info.
Perform caches pre-linking.
Override values from 'konan.properties' with the given ones.
When to destroy the runtime – 'legacy' and 'on-shutdown' are currently supported. Note that 'legacy' mode is deprecated and will be removed.
GC to use – 'noop', 'stms', and 'cms' are currently supported. This works only with '-memory-model experimental'.
Initialize top level properties lazily per file.
Unhandled exception processing in 'Worker.executeAfter'. Possible values: 'legacy' and 'use-hook'. The default value is 'legacy' and for '-memory-model experimental', the default value is 'use-hook'.
Choose the LLVM distribution that will be used during compilation.
Specify a binary option.
Enable logging of Native runtime internals.
Path to a file for dumping the list of all available tests.
Use lazy IR for cached libraries.
Omit binary when compiling the framework.
Continue compilation from the given bitcode file.
Serialized dependencies to use for linking.
Path for writing backend dependencies.
Directory that should contain the results of '-Xsave-llvm-ir-after=<phase>'.
Custom path to the location of konan distributions.
Custom set of LLVM passes to run as the ModuleOptimizationPipeline.
Custom set of LLVM passes to run as the LTOOptimizationPipeline.
Comma-separated list that will be written as the value of 'native_targets' property in the .klib manifest. Unknown values are discarded.
Destination for generated .kotlin_metadata files.
List of directories and JAR/ZIP archives to search for user .kotlin_metadata files.
Name of the generated .kotlin_module file.
Paths to output directories for friend modules (modules whose internals should be visible).
Paths to output directories for refined modules (modules whose expects this module can actualize).
Produce a legacy metadata jar instead of metadata klib. Suitable only for K2 compilation
